meanings.definition: More suitable or fit for traveling on the sea.
meanings.sent1: The sturdy ship was seaworthier than the small boat.
meanings.sent2: The captain chose the seaworthier vessel for the long voyage.
meanings.sent3: The seaworthier lifeboat made the other sailors jealous.
meanings.sent4: Her seaworthier skills in navigation guided them safely through the storm.
meanings.sent5: The seaworthier ship cut through the waves effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Capable of withstanding rough seas or adverse weather conditions.
meanings.sent1: The seaworthier boat easily rode out the storm.
meanings.sent2: Sailors prefer seaworthier vessels for their durability.
meanings.sent3: The seaworthier ship laughed at the raging sea.
meanings.sent4: His seaworthier resolve kept him steady in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The seaworthier lighthouse stood strong against the fierce winds.
